page.title: 06BURNHAM MARKET LANDSCAPE
page.content: Seen from the top of Beacon Hill (184 feet above sea level) our landscape is primarily one of rural agriculture with the sea in the background. The fields of crops are large, with hedges and ditches marking their boundaries. The north- eastern sector of this area contains many houses and much new building work. The cottages at the foot of Beacon Hill Road are good examples of local domestic architecture of the last century: traditional local buildings such as these have walls of flint and very steep roofs covered with Norfolk pantiles. Bricks came from the brickworks at Peterstone Farm, Holkham. Modern builders are encouraged to use these traditional materials wherever possible and some of the new buildings blend in very successfully with the old.
